sections.heading: Short title. This Act may be cited as the In-Office Membership Care Act.
sections.text: Short title. This Act may be cited as the In-Office Membership Care Act.

sections.heading: Public policy.   It is the policy of the State of Illinois to promote personal responsibility for health care and the cost-effective delivery of dental services by encouraging innovative use of in-office membership care practices for dental care
sections.text: In-office membership care practices utilize a model o

sections.heading: Location of in-office membership care services
sections.text: In-office membership care services may be provided in a dental care provider's office or another location in which a patient visit with the dental care provider needs to occur.

sections.heading: Insurance billing prohibited.  Neither the patient nor the dental care provider shall submit a bill to an insurer for the services provided under an in-office membership care agreement
sections.text: Insurance billing prohibited. Neither the patient nor the dental care provider shall submit a bill to an insurer for the services provided under an in-office membership care agreement.

sections.heading: In-office membership care agreements not classified as insurance
sections.text: In-office membership care agreements are not subject to regulation as insurance under the Illinois Insurance Code.

sections.heading: Disclaimer.  An in-office membership care agreement shall include the following disclaimer: "This agreement does not provide health insurance coverage, including the minimal essential coverage required by applicable federal law
sections.text: It provides only the services described herein. It is recommended that

sections.heading: Restrictions on transfer.  An in-office membership care agreement may not be sold or transferred by the dental care provider without the written consent of the patient and may be transferred only to another dental care provider
sections.text: An in-office membership care agreement may not be sold to a group, empl

sections.heading: Effect of this Act.  This Act does not prohibit dental care providers who are not dental care providers offering in-office membership care agreements from entering into agreements with patients to the extent such agreements do not violate the provisions of the Illinois Insurance Code
sections.text: Effect of this Act. This Act does not prohibit dental care providers who are not dental care providers offering in-office membership care agreements from entering into agreements with patients to the extent such agreements do not violate the provisions of the Illinois Insurance Code.

sections.heading: Effective date. This Act takes effect upon becoming law.
sections.text: Effective date. This Act takes effect upon becoming law.
